title: Reporting on the bill length of penguins
text: Copied everything from this [guy] (https://www.jumpingrivers.com/blog/quarto-for-python-users/)

title: Reporting on the bill length of penguins
text:
Abstract
Prepare yourself for a life-changing article about penguins…

title: Reporting on the bill length of penguins
text:
Introduction
Penguins are a family (Spheniscidae) of aquatic flightless birds that live primarily in the Southern Hemisphere. Their diet consists of:

Krill
Fish
Squid
More fish

There are 18 species of penguin, including:

Macaroni penguin (Eudyptes chrysolophus)
Chinstrap penguin (Pygoscelis antarcticus)
Gentoo penguin (Pygoscelis papua)

title: Reporting on the bill length of penguins
text:
Methods
To determine whether a higher body mass implies a longer bill, we loaded a penguins dataset using pandas:

import pandas as pd

data = pd.read_csv(
    'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-07-28/penguins.csv'
)
data.head()








species
island
bill_length_mm
bill_depth_mm
flipper_length_mm
body_mass_g
sex
year

title: Reporting on the bill length of penguins
text:
Results
The figure below shows the bill length plotted as a function of the body mass for three species across a 3-year period.


        
        
        
Bill length as a function of body mass


                            
                                            




According to our data, the average bill length is 43.9 mm.

title: Index
text:
This is a Quarto website. This is basically just a test to see how useable Quarto is.

here’s a link
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

from ipyleaflet import Map, Marker, basemaps, basemap_to_tiles
m = Map(
  basemap=basemap_to_tiles(
    basemaps.NASAGIBS.ModisTerraTrueColorCR, "2017-04-08"
  ),
  center=(52.204793, 360.121558),
  zoom=4
)
m.add_layer(Marker(location=(52.204793, 360.121558)))
m
